qas.question: Who controls aircraft on the runway?
Who controls aircraft in the controlled airspace immediately surrounding the airport?
Tower controllers use what to locate an aircraft's position in three-dimensional space?
Why should aircraft that is only passing through an airspace contact Tower Control?

answers.text: in order to be sure that they remain clear of other traffic

plausible_answers.text: aircraft on the runway and in the controlled airspace immediately surrounding the airport

qas.question: What is controlled by the pilot?
What does the airport use to locate an aircraft?
What does the pilot coordinate in the traffic pattern?
Who must contact the other pilot when passing through airspace?

plausible_answers.text: direct aircraft on how to safely join and leave the circuit

qas.question: What does a pilot do when there is more than one plane in the air?

context: <a0_0><a1_0>Tower Control<a1_0/><a0_0/> controls <b4_0>aircraft on the runway and in the controlled airspace immediately surrounding the airport<b4_0/>. Tower controllers may use <a2_0><b5_0>radar<b5_0/><a2_0/> to locate an aircraft's position in three-dimensional space, or they may rely on pilot position reports and visual observation. They coordinate <b6_0>the sequencing of aircraft<b6_0/> in the traffic pattern and <b8_0>direct aircraft on how to safely join and leave the circuit<b8_0/>. <b7_0>Aircraft<b7_0/> which are only passing through the airspace must also contact Tower Control <a3_0>in order to be sure that they remain clear of other traffic<a3_0/>.
